intro: Oldenlandia bonincola, commonly known as the Bonin ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories or along stream banks.
